project.teaser: AWARD recognises the urgency of action due to water scarcity and climate change impacts as well as the need to engage simultaneously the society, the science and the policy into the development of knowledge and strategic water planning. Therefore, AWARD will provide...
project.objective: AWARD recognises the urgency of action due to water scarcity and climate change impacts as well as the need to engage simultaneously the society, the science and the policy into the development of knowledge and strategic water planning. Therefore, AWARD will provide evidence-based solutions to consider AWRs into water supply strategic plans, based on socio-political engagement. The 4 Demo Cases of AWARD are already implementing AWRs (storm water, rainwater and aquifer recharge in Bucharest in Romania as well as in Milano in Italy; water reuse in Cyprus, storm water and rainwater in an industrial park in Santiago di Compostel in Spain). Through the project activities, Demo Cases will consider scaling up their actions taking in account a broader range of AWRs together with conventional water resources for planning future water supply systems at local or regional level using AWARD instruments (Local Water Fora, Digital Platform for decision making, training and guidance). They will address similar issues in a harmonised and coordinated way. Societal awareness to support the decision process on AWRs supply solutions will lead to the recommendations for further use of AWRs encompassing the 4 dimensions of social innovation (Technological, Capacity development, Governance & Policy, Economics & assessment). The AWARD AWRs catalogue will gather the project results and additional solutions which will be benchmarked. The digital platform provided by AWARD will support the exploration of resilient scenarios that will be promoted beyond the scope of the project thanks to dedicated networking activities. AWARD general objective is to provide evidence-based knowledge and lessons learnt on how to effectively integrate affordable, acceptable and reliable AWRs solutions into water supply strategic planning and implementation considering the effect of global changes.
project.title: Alternative Water Resources and Deliberation process to renew water supply strategic planing
project.keywords: Non conventional water resources, reuse, artificial recharge, storm water, rain water, participatory decision maiking

article.title: Testing alternative solutions to address water scarcity

result.title: "Demo case#4 Implementation progress report"
result.description: This deliverable will summarise the main results from Demo case 4 located in Santiago de Compostela (ES). It will follow the recommendations established in D5.1 to harmonise the management and communication structures among all demo cases. It will gather the main results on operation of the pilot plant to assure quality thresholds for water reuse in public or private purposes in the surrounding area. This deliverable is linked to task T5.2/Subtask 5.2.4

result.title: Conception of the DST-TSD as the Digital Twin of the AWARD Project
result.description: D4.1 is the Beta-prototype of the DST-TSD knowledge gateway, scheduled to be operational at Month M20 of the Project. The gateway (DST-TSD for “Deliberation Support Tool for Territorial Sustainable Development”), is the “Digital Twin” of the AWARD Project. Exploiting ePLANETe functionalities covering visualisation, spatial representation of water technologies and their territories, cataloguing, tools and applications of evaluation, deliberation support, and documentation, it will provide operational support and a “mirror” of the Project’s activities in their material, methodological, spatial and institutional dimensions. This deliverable is the core outcome of Task T4.1. It is directly linked to Tasks T4.2, T4.3 and T4.4 for realisation of digital content, and reflexively to Tasks T4.5 and T4.6 for quality assurance and documentation.

result.title: AWARD Value Proposition
result.description: To build the Exploitation Road map of AWARD, 3 steps will be followed: 1) development of the AWARD value proposition, 2) development of a Business Canvas and 3) design of the Exploitation plan. D6.9 corresponds to the first step for establishing the AWARD exploitation plan and will hence present the AWARD Value Proposition Canvas. This aims at bringing together the description of the different products and services that the project will deliver (value proposition map) with the needs of the potential end-users. This deliverable is linked to task T6.3.

result.title: Synergies with CL6-2023-Climate-01-2
result.description: This deliverable will be, in the ideal case, produced collectively with the 2 other projects funded under CL6-2023-Climate-01-2 call. It will identify and plan the potential synergies between the 3 sister project’s activities (MARCLAIMED, RECREATE and AWARD). Opportunities for synergies can concern a common scope of work or complementarities. Both will participate to deliver the expected impacts of the 3 projects, as described in their DoA, and potentially also to create new unforeseen ones. This deliverable is linked to task T1.4.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - AWARD (Alternative Water Resources and Deliberation process to renew water supply strategic planing)
result.teaser: Europe’s freshwater resources are under increasing stress causing more frequent and widespread water-related extremes such as water scarcity, drought and floods in several regions. The recent European Union Water Resilience Strategy recognises the need for member states to...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Communication and dissemination plan
result.description: The communication and dissemination plan will include guidelines on how to communicate project activities and deliverables (for who?, what?, how? and when?) following the requirements established by Horizon Europe in terms of visibility and communication. This Plan is expected to be drafted on the first month after the project starts and will be implemented on month 6. This deliverable is linked to task T.6.1

result.title: "Demo case#2 Implementation progress report"
result.description: "The report will describe the status at Month#20 for the implementation of the Demo case#2 in Milan metropolitan area (Italy), by installing monitoring devices and planning monitoring actions (as i.e. citizens science events) in some of the recently installed SUDS (sustainable urban drainage systems) in the city and its province. This deliverable is linked to task T5.2"

result.title: Mid-term report on performed communication and dissemination activities
result.description: Report gathering and monitoring all the actions performed, the impacts and results achieved and potential updates needed for the initial communication and dissemination plan (D.6.1) This deliverable is linked to task T.6.1

result.title: Harmonised Pilot Site Interest Groups implementation guidelines including a stakeholder mapping
result.description: In this deliverable will be presented the common method for the 4 demo cases to organise the work to be carried out and to create, implement and facilitate the Transversal Interest Group (TIG). This group will recruit members based on an initial stakeholder mapping aiming at identifying which interest groups can be affected, at different scales (including authorities). This deliverable is linked to tasks T5.1 and T6.1.

result.title: AWRs regulatory, policy framework and funding mechanism
result.description: This deliverable will examine the European regulation regarding AWRs and water quality standards. In addition, since many countries apply specific standards and existing national regulations, the national situation will be explored (focusing on 1. the AWARD-case study countries and 2. countries in Eastern Europe already part of the Local Water Forum Network as the ones of the Lower Danube Basin). The review will include the public funding mechanisms (at various levels) to highlight the existing public funding programs for innovative AWRs and to identify potential gaps. This deliverable is mainly linked to task T2.1., but also WP3.1, WP4, WP5 and WP6

result.title: "Demo case#1 Implementation progress report"
result.description: "The report will describe the status at Month#20 for the implementation of the Demo case#1 in ''Circus Lake'' urban park Bucharest (Romania). The report will include the results of the monitoring system and planning monitoring actions in ''Circus Lake'' urban park Bucharest. For the urban area in the Tei neighbourhood, rainfall-runoff modelling will be developed to quantify the volumes of water that could be captured to be reused in controlling the Circus lake's water level. The report will also include the results of a local model simulating groundwater – infrastructure interaction analysing the potential behaviour of the urban aquifer system and the volumes required to recharge it with water. This deliverable is linked to the task T5.2"

result.title: "AWARD social innovation factsheet #1"
result.description: Social innovation is a raising concept that considers as equally important the technological and non-technological dimensions of innovation. The objective of the AWARD series of 3 Social Innovation Factsheet (SIF) is to explain how the project 'results address key societal challenges (such as climate change impacts, water scarcity or regulatory evolving context). Each SIF will hence present all the dimensions of one AWARD innovative solution: technological, capacity development, governance and economics. The topics of each of the 3 SIF will be decided under the course of the project. D6.4 is the first SIF of the series of 3. This deliverable is linked to tasks T6.2 and T5.2.

result.title: AWARD Training plan
result.description: D6.7 aims at identifying the needs and capacity of potential users of the AWARD solutions to support water supply strategic planning renewal such as AWARD DST-TSD that will be developed by WP4. This deliverable will present the training plan developed in order to capacitate water stakeholders to make informed choices on AWRs solutions, tailored to their territory scale, challenges and interests. This deliverable is linked to task T6.2.

result.title: "Demo case#3 Implementation progress report"
result.description: This deliverable will summarise the main results from Demo case 3 located in Paralimni/Agia Napa of Cyprus (CY) regarding urban water reuse for irrigation purposes. The Deliverable will explain the actions which were implemented within the project for this case study as well as the results to address the challenges on water reuse. This deliverable is linked to task 5.2 and specifically subtask 5.2.3.

result.title: Intermediate Data Management Plan
result.description: This is the first update of the Data Management Plan (D1.5). In this intermediate version, the initial list of datasets linked to each task will be updated and a detailed description of the datasets produced during the first 18 months will be presented in annexes. A synthetic state-of progress, based on this report, will be included in the mid-term periodic report. This deliverable is linked to task T1.3.

result.title: Initial Data Management Plan
result.description: This deliverable is the first version of the data management plan that will be updated twice. It will include a description of the procedures applicable by all the partners to manage the whole data collected and/or generated during the project activities. The objective is to ensure that the research data will be findable, accessible, interoperable and re-usable (FAIR). This deliverable is linked to task T1.3.

result.title: "Quality Assurance and monitoring plan #2"
result.description: This deliverable is the first update of deliverable D1.2, at mid-term (M18). It will allow to include updated information about quality assurance, risk management and project KPI in the mid-term periodic report. This deliverable is linked to task T1.2.

result.title: "AWARD policy Brief #1"
result.description: The AWARD will produce 3 policy briefs in order to provide an overview of the importance of diversifying the AWR methods addressed in the project and in general. It will offer recommendations for governments and other Quadruple Helix organizations to promote and integrate AWR in the water management plans (ex. invest in R&D, education, new regulatory frameworks, new incentives programs, etc.). D2.2 is the first policy brief of a series of 3. This deliverable is linked to tasks T2.2 and T2.3.

result.title: "Quality Assurance and monitoring plan #1"
result.description: This deliverable will present the procedures and monitoring tools that the partners will have to implement and follow, all along the 3 years of the project concerning: the quality assurance, the risk management and the project impact (dashboard of the project hey performance indicators). This deliverable is linked to task T1.2.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
